metadata.title: CVE-2020-10751 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernels SELinux LSM hook implementationbefore version 5.7, where it incorrectly assumed that an skb would onlycontain a single netlink message. The hook would incorrectly only validatethe first netlink message in the skb and allow or deny the rest of themessages within the skb with the granted permission without furtherprocessing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10751` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-184-generic - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-184-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1073-aws - 4.4.0-1073.77
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1089-azure - 4.15.0-1089.99~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1073.77').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1089.99~14.04.1').
